attributes.action: Discuss giving BTEC students predicted grades due to COVID-19
attributes.additional_details: "Learning from home" is very stressful for students, as it lacks face to face interactions that are necessary to learn.Being self taught from home via the internet is making it difficult to finish work correctly and receive feedback for work done, in addition to straining teachers who have to work around this.The majority of students undertaking BTEC qualifications will under perform and gain low grades, in addition to being closed at home with the entire family and under constant distraction.
attributes.background: The Government should consider giving BTEC college students predicted grades instead of completing assignments and coursework at home whilst unable to physically attend classes due to COVID-19 teachers should be allowed to reinstate new predicted grades fairly before they're submitted.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, not the UK Government or Parliament. You can read the Government's announcement about what will happen to exams here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/further-details-on-exams-and-grades-announced

Ofqual has stated that it is working with awarding organisations to finalise a list of qualifications that we will advise the Secretary of State should be in scope for learners to receive a calculated result, and this will include many BTEC Nationals: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/awarding-vocational-and-technical-qualifications-this-summer

If you want the Government to review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades, you may wish to sign this petition:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak. 
 
Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
 
Read correspondence with Government Ministers asking further questions: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/
